text: John Michael "Jack" Shewchuk (June 19, 1917 - May 15, 1989) was a Canadian professional ice hockey defenceman. He was born in Brantford, Ontario. Shewchuk played in the National Hockey League for the Boston Bruins between 1938 and 1945, playing a total of 187 regular season games and 20 playoff games. He won the Stanley Cup with the Bruins in 1941. ==External links== *Picture of Jack Shewchuk's Name on the 1941 Stanley Cup Plaque * Category:1917 births Category:1989 deaths Category:Boston Bruins players Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:Canadian people of Ukrainian descent Category:Hershey Bears players Category:Providence Reds players Category:St. Louis Flyers players Category:Stanley Cup champions Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:Sportspeople from Brantford
title: Jack Shewchuk
